key_points: The speaker Ryota wants to share a theme that makes Emacs aesthetically pleasing to his taste
He started with the Nova Theme but found it too colourful and distracting
He experimented with different themes like Modus Vivendi Tinted, ef-themes, owl edition, and Doom Noe
He used Org Mode to create a subtle theme with orange as an accent colour
The speaker talks about colour spaces like sRGB, HSL, LCH, and perceptual uniformity

technical_terms.definition: A system for describing and categorizing colours
technical_terms.name: Colour Space

technical_terms.definition: A colour model that describes colours in terms of hue (colour), saturation (purity), and lightness (brightness)
technical_terms.name: HSL Colour Space

technical_terms.definition: Another colour model that describes colours in terms of luminance (lightness), chroma (colourfulness), and hue
technical_terms.name: LCH Colour Space

technical_terms.definition: A property of a colour space where the perceived colours are evenly distributed, making it more suitable for designing themes and colours
technical_terms.name: Perceptual Uniformity

technical_terms.definition: An organization that developed important colour spaces like CIE XYZ, CIELAB, and LUV
technical_terms.name: CIE

technical_terms.definition: Years when the CIE XYZ and LUV colour spaces were created
technical_terms.name: Colour Space Creation Years
